forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 45. West wind 7 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 51, with temperatures falling to around 43 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 14 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph.

weather_report:
As night drapes itself over Boston, the air is crisp, laden with a gentle stillness, punctuated only by the rustle of early autumn leaves. With temperatures dipping towards a cool 45 degrees, a west wind softly breathes through the streets, carrying with it that familiar bite of the season. The sky, mostly clear, reveals scattered stars that twinkle amid the muted glow of city lights, hinting at the charming quietude of the night.

The dawn will greet us with the brightness of a sunny morning, offering a high near 51 that will gradually wane to a more tranquil 43 in the afternoon. The northwest winds, spirited at times, may dance at speeds reaching up to 20 mph, making a light jacket or sweater a wise choice for those venturing outdoors. This setting calls for a stroll along the Charles River, where the reflections of the sun on the water bring warmth to the cool breeze, or perhaps a cozy reading nook with a warm drink in hand as the day gracefully unfolds. A walk in the nearby parks wouldn’t go amiss either, especially with the vibrant colors of autumn lingering in the air, encouraging introspection and appreciation for the moment.
